page.title: 07GOXHILL PRIORY RESTORED.
page.content: Goxhill Priory is a 13th century Fortified Manor House. In 1976 it was purchased together with the adjacent 18th century Hall by architects Mr & Mrs Graham. They chanced to see the property when they missed a ferry to Hull at New Holland and looked around the area. They received grants towards the restoration of both Hall and Priory. A group of volunteers helped to excavate and restore the Priory's barrel vaulted undercroft. The Great Hall, at first floor level, is now in good repair though access to it is not easy as the wooden exterior staircase has been missing for some time and a spiral staircase is the only means of entry. It was a condition of the grant aid towards its restoration that the Priory should be open to the public on request. There are between two and three hundred visitors each year.
